articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck the northern foothills of the Himalayas near one of Tibet's holiest cities on Tuesday, damaging buildings around Shigatse and sending people running into the streets in neighbouring Nepal and India.
articles.title: Powerful earthquake hits holy city in China's Tibet

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: Behind rows of barbed wire and a small army of personal security, impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol remained holed up in his sprawling hillside villa with his wife, dogs and cats on Tuesday as investigators planned his arrest.
articles.title: South Korea's impeached leader Yoon hunkers down in Seoul's 'Beverly Hills'

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: The United Arab Emirates has discussed with Israel and the United States participating in a provisional administration of post-war Gaza until a reformed Palestinian Authority is able to take charge, according to people familiar with the talks.
articles.title: Exclusive: UAE in talks with US, Israel about provisional government for post-war Gaza

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Simon Lewis, Trevor Hunnicutt, Tim Kelly
articles.description: The deal rejection has jolted US efforts to boost ties with its Asian allies.
articles.title: Blinken visits Japan as Nippon Steel decision weighs on relations

articles.author: Joyce Zhou, Minwoo Park, Eduardo Baptista
articles.description: As impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol fights for his political survival, the embattled leader has found an ally among young conservative men.
articles.title: South Korea's embattled leader Yoon finds allies among young conservative men

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least three Palestinian militants in stepped-up operations across the occupied West Bank on Tuesday following the killing of three Israelis near a Jewish settlement, the Israeli military said.
articles.title: Three Palestinians killed in the West Bank as Israeli military operations intensify

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw a successful test of a new intermediate-range hypersonic ballistic missile (IRBM) on Monday, state media KCNA said on Tuesday, pledging to accelerate the country's nuclear and missile capabilities.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim oversees successful test of new hypersonic missile

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A South Korean court has re-issued a warrant to arrest impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol, the country's corruption investigation agency said on Tuesday.
articles.title: South Korean court re-issues arrest warrant for impeached President Yoon

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Yimou Lee
articles.description: Taiwan's coast guard has said that it suspects a ship damaged an undersea communications cable over the weekend, but that bad weather prevented its personnel from boarding the vessel to investigate.
articles.title: Taiwan coast guard says investigation of damaged undersea cable stymied by weather

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: South Korea's transport minister said on Tuesday he intends to step down to take responsibility for the deadly crash of a Boeing jet operated by Jeju Air on Dec. 29.
articles.title: South Korean transport minister plans to resign over country's worst air crash
